byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Memo from the United Nations; Gambia's announcement that it will withdraw from International Criminal Court presents most serious challenge to court's existence, particularly as statement comes on heels of similar decisions by Burundi and South Africa; Gambia's withdrawal is doubly significant in that court's chief prosecutor Fatou Bensouda is Gambian; African nations have objected to what they say is inordinate focus by court on African continent.

headline.main: As 3 African Nations Vow to Exit, International Court Faces Its Own Trial

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The announcements by Gambia, Burundi and South Africa intensify a longstanding debate over whether the body is biased against the continent....
lead_paragraph: The announcements by Gambia, Burundi and South Africa intensify a longstanding debate over whether the body is biased against the continent.
